raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences/rows that meet the criteria:


By Scatchard analysis, the ET<sub>A</sub> receptor shows an apparant dissociation constant (Kd) of 44 pM and maximum binding sites (Bmax) of 342 fmol/mg protein, while the ET<sub>B</sub> receptor has a Kd of 8 pM and Bmax of 362 fmol/mg protein.
The following table shows the results of the binding assay as % inhibition of the specific ET<sub>A</sub> and ET<sub>B</sub> receptor binding by respectively 10<sup>-5</sup> M and 10<sup>-7</sup> M of the test compounds:
 1     37         55                                                      
 4     74         93                                                      
 7     77         87                                                      
12     36         91                                                      
55     94         100         440    1                                    
57     34         95                                                      
65     47         59                                                      
84     46         70                                                      
91     100        100         54     0.23     
From the inhibition curves for the binding of  <sup>125</sup> I!ETs, the apparant binding affinity constant (Ki) of one of the test compounds (example 55) is calculated as a parameter of the affinity for the ET<sub>A</sub> and ET<sub>B</sub> receptors.
